title: What are the maximum number of atoms in 24gm of C(12)? - Quora

response.answer_text: This is based on mole concept. So, Molar mass of C-12, M is 12 g. The given mass, m is 24 g. We know that the avagadro number is 6.023*10^23 n Thus, n= m/M*avagadro number That is 24/12*6.023*10^23 = 12.046*10^23 atoms. Therefore 24 g of C-12 contains 12.046*10^23 atoms.

This question is based on mole concept  No. of moles of C = Wt. of C in gm/ at. wt. of C  No. of moles of C = 24/12 = 2 No. atoms of C = no. of moles of C × Avogadro constant No. of atom of C = 2× 6.022×10^23 = 12.044 × 10^23Or 1.204×10^24No. of atom of C = 1.204×10^24 Ans. Thank you.

I don’t understand why did you use the term “maximum”. Maybe you are talking about a pure sample. Well, as the molecular weight of C12 is 12, thus, 12 gm of C12 = 1 mol C12 24 gm of C12 = 2 mol C12 Now 1 mol cobtains 6.023 * 10^23 atoms Thus 2 mol i.e. 24 gm of C12 contains 2*6.023*10^23 atoms = 12.046 * 10^23 atoms.

Assuming that there is no impurity present, the maximum number of atoms in that case would be 2×6.023×(10^22). The calculation is simple and as follows- Molar mass of carbon=12g Since no. Of moles of atoms = (weight)/(molar mass) Therefore the total number of atoms =24/12 moles=2moles =2×6.023×(10^22).
